Tech: Visual Basic for Applications - Excel

This is the app that started it all. Written for the Tesla Property and Title team, this is the code that put me on the path to becoming a developer. What was meant as a one-off solution to a workflow problem has blossumed into a full blown passion for app development.

This code belongs to Tesla, and cannot be listed in a repository, which is probably for the best =) Built with hours on YouTube and Udemy, and through sheer force of will, I hammered at this code to make it do what was needed. The code is ugly, but completely functional. It creates contracts from inputs on custom forms. It generates emails based on case profiles. It organizes a messy and complicated process.

Tech: React, Node.js, Express, PostgreSQL

Stamp Champ was also written for Tesla, though it was written completely on my own time and is fully owned by me. Stamp Champ was written to replace our in-house Chrome Extension 'QuickNotes'. Stamp Champ takes snippets of text and copies them to the clipboard. This is designed to speed up adding case notes during case management, help automate emails, and any other time when using the same text over and over.

Stamp Champ was my first full stack web app. While writing this app I was able to practice my React skills, and learned authentication with JSON Web Tokens, the context api, and React Router, among other things.

See the GitHub readme for a complete description...

Tech: React, Nodejs, Express, MongoDB, Mongoose

Smart Grocery is a full stack web app. It is written in React, Node, Express and MongoDB. It sorts your grocery list by store and aisle. Your entries can contain personal descriptions and your submissions are stored.

You can search for previously purchased items in real time.

Tech: HTML, CSS, JavaScript, SaSS
